metadata.Title: CVE-2020-7238 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Netty 4.1.43.Final allows HTTP Request Smuggling because it mishandles Transfer-Encoding whitespace (such as a [space]Transfer-Encoding:chunked line) and a later Content-Length header. This issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2019-16869. It was discovered that Netty has HTTP request smuggling vulnerability. A remote attacker could use it to extract sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-7238` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnetty-java - 1:4.1.45-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: netty package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.1.45-1').
